result.execSummary:
The defendant Remon Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 01/04/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

Straight Time. Sentence credit of 2 days were granted. Time Served.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Remon Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Remon Davis in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court perfroms plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  2 Days jail  (2 days credit)  -  TIME SERVED -

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 1/4/16, alternate 9 days jail if not paid) 

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney J Anthony Rosario in court.   Defendant Remon Davis did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests a jury status and jury trial date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
